name: Sankore Mosque
description: A historic UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the oldest educational centers in the world. The Sankore Mosque was an essential part of Timbuktu's golden age as a center of Islamic learning.

name: Ahmed Baba Institute
description: Home to thousands of ancient manuscripts, the Ahmed Baba Institute preserves Timbuktu's intellectual heritage. Visit to see rare historical documents dating back to the 13th century.

name: Djinguereber Mosque
description: Built in 1327, this massive adobe structure is one of Timbuktu's three great mosques. Its distinctive towers and unique Sudano-Sahelian architectural style make it an iconic landmark.

name: Timbuktu Ethnographic Museum
description: Explore the rich cultural heritage of Timbuktu and the surrounding region. The museum features artifacts, traditional clothing, musical instruments, and multimedia exhibits about local traditions.

name: Sahara Desert Tours
description: Experience the majesty of the Sahara Desert with guided camel tours and overnight camping excursions. Witness breathtaking sunsets and the brilliant stars of the desert night sky.

name: Niger River Cruise
description: Take a scenic boat ride along the historic Niger River, the lifeline of the region. Cruises offer views of traditional fishing villages, wildlife, and beautiful landscapes along the riverbanks.

name: Traditional Craft Market
description: Browse a colorful array of handcrafted goods including leather work, jewelry, textiles, and carved wooden items. Meet local artisans and learn about traditional crafting techniques.

name: Desert Oasis Restaurant
description: Savor authentic Malian cuisine in a beautiful setting with garden terraces. Specialties include traditional dishes like tieboudienne (fish and rice), maf√© (peanut stew), and refreshing hibiscus drinks.
